title: Thousands gather outside White House to protest Trump’s immigration ban
text:
Protesters angry about Donald Trump’s immigration ban against seven Muslim-majority nations took their beef straight to the president’s front door Sunday.

Thousands rallied outside the White House chanting, “This is what America looks like!” in response to Trump’s executive order that shut America’s door to newcomers from Syria, Yemen, Sudan, Somalia, Iraq, Iran and Libya.

“The people united, will never be divided” and “No hate, no fear, refugees are welcome here,” they also yelled.

This marked the second consecutive weekend that mass protests have erupted across the nation against President Trump.

While last week’s Women’s March took on Trump over a host of issues, Sunday’s nationwide furor specifically targeted the president’s Muslim ban, which he signed into action on Friday. It included:
summary:
Protesters angry about Donald Trump’s immigration ban against seven Muslim-majority nations took their beef straight to the president’s front door Sunday.
Thousands rallied outside the White House chanting, “This is what America looks like!” in response to Trump’s executive order that shut America’s door to newcomers from Syria, Yemen, Sudan, Somalia, Iraq, Iran and Libya.
“The people united, will never be divided” and “No hate, no fear, refugees are welcome here,” they also yelled.
This marked the second consecutive weekend that mass protests have erupted across the nation against President Trump.
While last week’s Women’s March took on Trump over a host of issues, Sunday’s nationwide furor specifically targeted the president’s Muslim ban, which he signed into action on Friday.
